Strategic Flexibility of U.S. Troops Flailed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 17 (KCNA) -- Members of the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, an anti-war peace organization in south Korea, reportedly held a demonstration in front of the building of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade in Seoul on July 13 in protest against the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. troops in south Korea.
 They contended that if the "flexibility" is allowed, peace in the Korean Peninsula will be threatened and south Korea will be involved in a war to be launched by the U.S. troops in Northeast Asia.    
 As a result, the existence of the Koreans will be seriously endangered, they said, calling for waging a struggle to check the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. troops.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Prime Minister of Jamaica 
    Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of sympathy to Prime Minister of Jamaica P.J. Patterson.
 Upon hearing the unfortunate news that Jamaica sustained a big loss from a recent strong hurricane in Caribbean region, he extended deep sympathy and consolation to the prime minister and the government and people of Jamaica.    
 He sincerely hoped that the government would remove the aftermath of the natural disaster and stabilize the people's living at an early date.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Fidel Castro
    Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of sympathy to Fidel Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State of Cuba, on Friday as regards the recent strong hurricane that hit different areas of Cuba, causing great human and material loss.
 Extending deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the government and people of Cuba as well as the inhabitants in the affected areas, the message expressed the belief that the Cuban government would remove the aftermath of the recent natural disasters and stabilize the life of the inhabitants in the affected areas as soon as possible.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Pakistani President
    Pyongyang, July 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of sympathy to Pervez Musharraf, president of Pakistan, in connection with the recent train accident in Southern Sind Province of Pakistan that claimed big casualties.
 Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the president and the government and the bereaved families and victims, the message sincerely hoped that the president and government of Pakistan would eradicate the aftermath of the disaster as early as possible.
